fr.inrialpes.exmo.align.service

Class SQLCache

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.inrialpes.exmo.align.service.VolatilCache
      • fr.inrialpes.exmo.align.service.SQLCache
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Cache

    public class SQLCache
extends VolatilCache
implements Cache
    This class implements, in addition to VolatilCache, the persistent storage of Alignments and networks In a SQL database. It loads Alignments and network from the database It stores them in the database on demand

      • retrieveAlignment

        protected Alignment retrieveAlignment(java.lang.String uri,
                                      Alignment alignment)
                               throws java.sql.SQLException,
                                      AlignmentException,
                                      java.net.URISyntaxException
        loads the full alignment from the database and put it in the alignmentTable hastable should be invoked when: ( result.getExtension(CACHED) == "" AND result.getExtension(STORED) != "") {
        Parameters:
        uri: - the uri of an alignment
        alignment: - the alignment structure containing its metadata
        Returns:
        the retrieved alignment
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - when the database is not accessible
        java.net.URISyntaxException - when the URI is invalid
        AlignmentException - when something else goes wrong (no corresponding alignment)

      • quote

        public static java.lang.String quote(java.lang.String s)
        quote: Prepare a string to be used in SQL queries by preceeding occurences of "'", """, and "\'" by a "\"". This should be implemented at a lower level within Java itself (or the sql package). This function is used here for protecting everything to be entered in the database
        Parameters:
        s: - a string to be passed to SQL
        Returns:
        the string with quotes protected
